com.orm.androrm
Class DatabaseAdapter

java.lang.Object
  com.orm.androrm.DatabaseAdapter

public class DatabaseAdapter
extends Object

This class provides access to the underlying SQLite database.

Author:
Philipp Giese

Method Detail

setDatabaseName

public static final void setDatabaseName(String name)
Set the name, that will be used for the database.

Parameters:
name - Name of the database.

setModels

public void setModels(List<Class<? extends Model>> models)
Registers all models, that will then be handled by the ORM.

Parameters:
models - List of classes inheriting from Model.

open

public DatabaseAdapter open()
                     throws SQLException
This opens a new database connection. If a connection or database already exists the system will ensure that getWritableDatabase() will return this Database. DO NOT try to do caching by yourself because this could result in an inappropriate state of the database.

Returns:
this to enable chaining.
Throws:
SQLException

close

public void close()
Closes the current connection to the database. Call this method after every database interaction to prevent data leaks.

drop

public void drop()
Drops all tables of the current database.

drop

public void drop(String tableName)
Drops a specific table

Parameters:
tableName - Name of the table to drop.

public Cursor query(SelectStatement select)

doInsertOrUpdate

public int doInsertOrUpdate(String table,
                            ContentValues values,
                            Where where)
Inserts values into a table that has an unique id as identifier.

Parameters:
table - The affected table.
values - The values to be inserted/ updated.
mId - The identifier of the affected row.
Returns:
The number of rows affected on update, the rowId on insert, -1 on error.

delete

public int delete(String table,
                  Where where)
Delete one object or a set of objects from a specific table.

Parameters:
table - Query table.
where - Where clause to find the object.
Returns:
Number of affected rows.
